sentences.en: Can you testify that you saw the defendant at the scene of the crime?
sentences.cn: 你能作证你看到被告在犯罪现场吗？

sentences.en: Fiers promised to testify fully and truthfully.
sentences.cn: 菲耶尔承诺所作证词将毫无保留且句句属实。

sentences.en: He hated to testify against a friend.
sentences.cn: 他不愿出庭去作对朋友不利的证词.

sentences.en: He offered to testify in favor of the accused.
sentences.cn: 他主动出庭作对被告有利的证词.

sentences.en: He will not testify against his own brother.
sentences.cn: 他不会出庭作对自己兄弟不利的证词.

sentences.en: He will testify in favor of the defendent.
sentences.cn: 他愿意出庭作对被告有利的证词.

sentences.en: Her actions testify her willingness to help.
sentences.cn: 她的事迹体现了她助人为乐的精神.

sentences.en: I can testify to his honesty.
sentences.cn: 我可以为他的诚实作证.

sentences.en: I can testify to this man's veracity and good character.
sentences.cn: 我可以作证,此人诚实可靠,品德良好.

sentences.en: In the next three or four days, eleven witnesses will be called to testify.
sentences.cn: 接下来的三四天里，将传唤11名证人出庭作证。

sentences.en: Mr Molto has agreed to testify at the trial.
sentences.cn: 莫尔托先生已经同意出庭作证。

sentences.en: Recent excavations testify to the presence of cultivated inhabitants on the hill during the Arthurian period.
sentences.cn: 最近几次发掘证实了亚瑟王时期这座山上有农耕人口居住过。

sentences.en: She refused to testify, unless the murder charge against her was dropped.
sentences.cn: 除非撤销对她的谋杀指控，否则她拒绝作证。

sentences.en: The empty shops in the high street testify to the depth of the recession.
sentences.cn: 大街上空无一人的商店说明了经济萧条的严重程度。

sentences.en: The fingerprint expert was asked to testify at the trial.
sentences.cn: 指纹专家应邀出庭作证.

sentences.en: The two youths today declined to testify because they said they feared for their safety.
sentences.cn: 这两个年轻人今天拒绝作证，称他们是出于对自身安全的担心。

sentences.en: Witnesses are unwilling to testify through fear of reprisals.
sentences.cn: 由于害怕报复，目击者不愿作证。

sentences.en: You're a businesswoman who's good at her job - bloody good; I can testify to that!
sentences.cn: 你是个精于此道的女生意人,精得很, 我能作证.

trans.tran_en: to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law
to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law

trans.tran_cn: 作证，证明，为…提供证明，公开宣称，宣布
trans.tran_en: to make a formal statement of what is true, especially in a court of law
